entry.title: Death, before the beginning
entry.summary:
Author: undeadmythos

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 860Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 3

Summary: She’d stopped the Reapers. The citadel was destroyed. No rebuilding. In their last efforts to kill Shepard, in a big, blinding flash of light, they sent her elsewhere. Now, a hundred years in the past, in a different universe, with gods, heroes, villains, and a certain red-helmet wearing vigilante, Shepard navigates through the unfamiliar territory. The past catching up to her. Would they accept her if they knew the truth? What she was? What she’d done? FemShep x Jason Todd - more info in first chapter <3

entry.title: an angel is near
entry.summary:
Author: twinflamedfool

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,000Chapters: 1/5Kudos: 1

Summary: For all that your father preaches about never killing, you’ve never been particularly attached to the rule, though you did follow it religiously. However, when the Joker kills Jason, all bets are off. Of course, the consequences of cold-blooded murder mean that you’ve been forcibly retired, your family cannot stand to look at you, and most importantly, you have been put under lock and key, or as close as you can get to that in the modern age, especially when you're a beloved, local celebrity. You can live with that if it means your brother is rightfully avenged, but what are you to do when, a few years later, you gain a heart-achingly familiar stalker? You’d believe him a hallucination if he hadn’t swept you away from the only place you’ve called home.

entry.title: Because I Have Issues
entry.summary:
Author: anastasia1513

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,860Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 54

Summary: You had been raised to be a pawn. You knew the game of the court. You had seen your own mother, a woman whose beauty was once legendary, fade into a quiet, bitter shadow, her spirit eroded by your father’s endless parade of mistresses. It had taught you a single, immutable lesson: men were creatures of appetite, and love was a fairytale told to keep girls compliant. Then came Jason. He was the General, the people’s hero, a man of common birth risen through sheer grit and military genius. The Senate, including your father, saw him as a threat, a wild card they needed to control. Marrying him to you, the most beautiful and coveted maiden in the capital, was meant to be a leash. They expected a sullen union, a strategic pairing of convenience. They hadn’t counted on the chemistry. He didn’t talk to you about dowries or land holdings. He found you in the library and asked about the epic you were reading. He debated philosophy with you, his sharp mind a thrilling match for your own. He made you laugh, a real, unguarded sound you hadn’t realized you were capable of.
